hints.label: def-order-invariant-functional-rigorous
hints.title: Order-Invariant Functional
hints.content:
947: :label: def-order-invariant-functional-rigorous
948: 
949: A functional $F: \mathcal{F} \to \mathbb{R}$ on Fractal Sets is **order-invariant** (or **causal-automorphism-invariant**) if:
950: 
951: $$
952: F(\psi(\mathcal{F})) = F(\mathcal{F})
953: $$
954: 
955: for all **causal automorphisms** $\psi$ - graph isomorphisms that preserve:
956: 1. CST temporal ordering (causality)
957: 2. IG edge structure
958: 
959: **Examples:**
960: - Total fitness: $F(\mathcal{F}) = \sum_{e \in \mathcal{E}} \Phi(e)$
961: - Episode measure: $\mu_{\text{epi}}(A) = |\{e : x_e \in A\}| / |\mathcal{E}|$
962: - Wilson loops: $W[\gamma] = \text{Tr}[\text{Hol}(\gamma)]$
963: 
964: **Physical interpretation:** Order-invariant functionals are the **gauge-invariant observables** of the theory.

hints.label: prop-cst-causal-set-axioms
hints.title: CST as Causal Set
hints.content:
972: :label: prop-cst-causal-set-axioms
973: 
974: The Causal Spacetime Tree (CST) of the Fractal Set satisfies the **axioms of causal set theory** (Bombelli, Lee, Meyer, Sorkin):
975: 
976: 1. **Partial order:** The temporal ordering $e_i \prec e_j$ (episode $i$ precedes $j$) is:
977:    - Reflexive: $e \prec e$
978:    - Antisymmetric: $e_i \prec e_j$ and $e_j \prec e_i$ implies $i = j$
979:    - Transitive: $e_i \prec e_j \prec e_k$ implies $e_i \prec e_k$
980: 
981: 2. **Local finiteness:** For any two episodes $e_i \prec e_k$, the set $\{e_j : e_i \prec e_j \prec e_k\}$ is finite.
982: 
983: 3. **Manifoldlikeness:** In the continuum limit $N \to \infty$, the causal structure approximates that of a Lorentzian manifold.
984: 
985: **Consequence:** The CST can be interpreted as a **discrete spacetime** in the sense of causal set quantum gravity.
